sentences.en: a formal agreement between the countries
A formal contract is signed which is renewable annually.
sentences.cn: 正式签订了每年可续签的合同。

sentences.en: Formal talks are still said to be a possibility, not a probability.
sentences.cn: 据称正式会谈仍有可能，但可能性不大。

sentences.en: Formal, exact and obstinate, he was also cold, suspicious, touchy and tactless.
sentences.cn: 严肃、严谨、倔强的他同时又冷漠、多疑、敏感、不会变通。
他几乎没受过正式的学校教育。

sentences.en: He kept the tone of the letter formal and businesslike.
sentences.cn: 他使这封信保持正式公文的语气。

sentences.en: Leroy didn't have any formal dance training.
sentences.cn: 勒罗伊没受过任何正规的舞蹈训练。

sentences.en: Steve didn't have the benefit of a formal college education.
sentences.cn: 史蒂夫没能接受正规的大学教育。

sentences.en: The Coronata wallpaper lends a formal air to the dining room.
sentences.cn: 科罗娜塔墙纸给餐厅增添了一种整齐有致的气氛。

sentences.en: The dinner was a formal affair.
The two sides met to put their signatures to a formal agreement.
sentences.cn: 双方聚首签署一份正式协议。

sentences.en: Their dinner parties had become considerably less formal.
sentences.cn: 他们的晚餐会已经远不如以前正式。

sentences.en: There is no formal linkage between the two agreements.
sentences.cn: 这两项协议之间不存在正式的关联。

sentences.en: There is no formal structure for negotiating pay increases.
sentences.cn: 加薪谈判没有正式的框架可循。

sentences.en: They agreed to draw up a formal agreement.
sentences.cn: 他们同意起草一份正式协议。

sentences.en: They decided to put their relationship on a more formal footing.
To soften a formal look, Caroline recommends ethnic blouses.
sentences.cn: 为了看上去不过于正式，卡罗琳建议穿有民族色彩的上衣。
